reviews.sentence: Pleasant and familiar stay near the airport. family friendly. If you have ever stayed in an Embassy Suites hotel you know that you can expect a comfortable room nice amenities free parking a hot breakfast cooked to order and a happy hour with free drinks for 2 hours every night. There are two self service laundries in the hotel in case you need to refresh your clothes during an extended trip. Internet is free only if you are an honors member but ask at the front desk for a temporary card. This hotel is a short 5 minute drive from the airport in an area filled with too many hotels and chain restaurants to mention. The breakfast is served in the central atrium which provides a nice white noise to fill the huge interior volume. You will see many families with children either going to or coming back from a theme park. We had surprisingly good food in the Kitty Hawk restaurant in the atrium which is conveniently open late if you are either jet lagged or had a late arriving flight. This is not a gourmet restaurant but they do a great job on the things they offer. One caution if you are getting gasoline in this area near the airport please be sure to double check the pump prices before you buy. There are two gas stations on the main highway which have little or no signage and outrageous prices. more than 2x higher than just a mile down the road.

Convenient to airport. Stayed 2 nights and found everything to be well done. Excellent service wonderful breakfast included snacks and drinks each night nice pool area. Everything was good. Very thoughtful shuttle drivers. Comfortable beds. Convenient to airport within walking distance to many restaurants. The shuttle was available to bring you to other restaurants further away.

Customer service does matter. When we first arrive the first room smelled like urine The next room we were put in the air was not working well the hall carpet was wet. Maintenance came in and put a big fan in there we had it in the room from the time we arrived til the next morning. We were gone from that morning till the evening we got to the room was told everything was fixed. The room smelled real musty and the carpet was wet stil. They moved us again. We got to the other room everything was working well. Until the next morning when our keys would not work they fixed that and after that the trip was good. There were two people that worked there that had great customer service the guy that checked us in I do not know his name. There was also a woman there name Aby from New York. If it would not have been for them two. This would have been a horrible trip. Customer service is very rare these days. But these two people have a great deal of it. I think they are a great asset to this hotel.

Excellent experience. Hotel we can recommend at any time. Nice clean and pleasant. Kind staff and very good breakfast. Electrical adapter for EU apliance was missing. This can be improved. Price was affordable and service was great.

My family stayed here the night before leaving on a cruise. We were completely pleased with our stay. The room was clean and spacious. They had an evening reception with free chips and salsa pretzels and crackers. Also free drinks including both beer and mixed drinks. They also had a shuttle from the airport and to restaurants near the hotel. That was also free. If we come back to Orlando I would definitely stay here again.
1 Niter. All well no issues. Good Buffet breakfast. Clean and comfortable room. Breakfast N A N A.
Daniele and Kieth are wonderful energetic employees who place customer service above all else. I will stay here everytime I visit Orlando.

Booking Snafu. The Embassy was amazing and happy we ended up there but NOT very happy how we ended up there. We had a reservation at another hotel and had the confirmation papers in my hand and was told they did not have a reservation under my name and they we booked for the night. It took two hours to get us into another hotel. Good thing we were there early and not arriving at 90 PM.

it is an excellent hotel through through. breakfast staff great. pool fitness room great. the rooms are great and the options around you in the area are great. my one complaint would be that the WiFi set up is not the most convenient but it is a small detractor.

Clean spacious rooms but work on being more green. Overall a really good experience in terms of the property and the super friendly and efficient team. However from an environmental perspective the hotel should look at some of its practices. It ’s all very well sticking up signs at breakfast to say your bagels are sourced locally when at the same time you are providing single use plastic bowls for your porridge oatmeal. The amount of plate waste from the buffet was shocking too. I did not check in until close to 8 pm but when I arrived in my room the ac unit was running. I am assuming that had been the case since it had been cleaned for arrival earlier that day. And the room did not even need it. First thing I did was switch it off. Such a terrible waste of energy. Rooms were spacious and clean and quiet. Staff were super helpful in the bar restaurant reception and house keeping. Refurb was not disruptive. Within 10 minute walk there is a mini complex with shopping dining and cinema if you have time to kill between checkout and flight times. Clarity around the airport shuttle times booking. Buffet breakfast choice good but not quality. Poor green practices re energy waste plastics.

Location was great for what we needed. It was overpriced in our opinion and the room was not clean. Location was perfect for what we were looking for. Room was not really clean. Tables had sticky stuff on them when we arrive. The sink was also dirty up at the rim so I just cleaned it myself and because of that we decided not to bother having someone clean our room since they did not do a good job anyway. I felt we paid an incredibly high price for a room of this condition. It was a little unnerving and in truth not what I would expect from an Embassy Suite.
Customer service was very lacking which is not the norm I have gotten at other embassy suites.

No indoor pool or private hot tubs so I was a bit disappointed with that but the hotel itself is really amazing. They have a happy hour in the evenings till 730 that serves free drinks and you can also have a few finger foods free breakfast every morning the rooms are nice and comfortably large they come with a large TV ours had three different sinks a living room area good size bathroom and a nice bedroom with a king size bed you get a small little dining table in the living room space a mini fridge microwave and coffee supplies. Room service and located really close to the airport as well as many food places. it is not right off a direct street so the quite was kind of nice too. Pool closes at 10 which I felt was early considering they did not have any inside and it is a vacation spot. Elevators were being worked on so that was a pain because the only one they had working was extremely slow and it might take you 25 minutes to get down we were only on the 4th floor also. Stairs are located outside for some weird reason so they were very hard to locate or use. Front desk is very friendly and helpful. Drivers and bartenders for the hotel were amazing also. Very clean and very comfortable place to stay. We were there for a week.

I love the hotel when i stayed there a week ago. The room was nice and spacious we only booked one night because the next day we were off to our 7 day cruise. The biggest thing i did nt like is i had to oay for wifi for my son tablet it was nt included. I did not like that at all especially bc this is not a cheap hotel so why would nt the wifi be free. Hm. Also the morning the breakfast was good but the omelts because of the over cooked bacon. But besides that the hotel was wonderful i love Hilton.

Embassy Suites just moved to the top of the list. The happy hour is great. The appetizers were not great but FREE NOT WATERED DOWN. DRINKS were just what the doctor ordered. The room was spacious and very clean. The tub needed alitle maintenance but overall it I enjoyed the room very much. Full size tvs yes two tvs and three sinks sealed the deal. Will be back. The early check in fee was disappointing but it is understandable.

Pleasant. The staff was helpful and friendly. And our bed was very comfortable. We did n’t know that renovations were taking place. Also the sink in our bathroom did n’t drain well. And there was a huge group of kids from a sports team that stayed. Very crowded and loud when we got back to the hotel around 11 pm.

Lovely stopover. I liked the lay out of the rooms the suite itself was well equipped super clean and the bed was massive and very comfortable. Not much not to like. The ice machines are a little noisy through the night. But other than that.

Served its purpose but overpriced. I love the made to order breakfasts and suite layout. This particular Embassy Suites was crowded due to airport proximity. Beds are always comfortable. Like that they offer happy hour snacks. No Wi Fi unles you ’re an Honors member. Parking fee.

The hotel is going through construction. I wish they had put that in the website when I booked. There is only one Ice machine for the whole hotel. I go down the flights to use it and it is not working. Really. A hotel in Florida has no I have machines. there is only two elevators for the whole hotel. The elevators have no lights. You do not know if it is going up or down no lighted arrows. No lights to know that the elevator is coming. The staff is nice but trying to get around with no I have and limited elevators makes it annoying.

Not so good this time. Checked into a room which had not been cleaned. Were quickly moved which was great once we got there. The buffet was very crowded with out sufficient refills thus people waited and waited. Final blow was when the elevator broke and for over 15 hours there was no assistance to help people transit the stairs.
